summary: Document scanning application with camera integration that converts scanned images to PDF format
architectural_notes: File picker integration for importing local documents

existing_features.title: Implement camera capture interface that allows users to take photos of documents using their device camera
Add image processing to detect document edges and apply perspective correction to captured images
Create document collection interface where users can scan multiple pages and manage them before PDF creation
Implement PDF generation functionality that converts scanned document images into a single PDF file
Add image enhancement options including brightness, contrast, and black-and-white conversion filters
Implement document library view where users can browse, search, and manage their saved scanned documents
Design a creative visual theme with a distinctive color palette, modern typography, and cohesive layout system that emphasizes clarity and efficiency for document scanning workflows
Add a file input component on the ScanPage that allows users to select image files from their local device (supporting common formats: JPEG, PNG, WebP)
Process locally imported image files through the same workflow as camera-captured images, including the ImageEditor step for corner detection and perspective correction
Update the ScanPage state management to handle both camera capture and file import as entry points into the document processing workflow
Display appropriate UI affordances that make the file import option discoverable alongside the existing camera capture interface

new_feature_requests.summary: Convert scanned documents to PDF format
Create backend storage system to save scanned documents and their metadata
Add option to import documents from local device files
